title: less Google results depending on the SearX language option
body:
Searching for the query `"Forum cliccando sul tasto rosso"` (with the inverted quotes), which is a random unique Italian sentence from a .it domain that should only find 1-2 results... might or might not find anything on SearX depending on the current language setting.

I searched the same query on every language supported by searx.me 0.14.0 with the default preferences. Only the searches performed with the Italian language settings (it, it-CH, it-IT) and for some reason Chinese (zh, zh-CN, zh-HK, zh-TW) found the result.
Strangely enough, that query seems to work correctly with Google Images in every language.

Next, I also tried these two unique queries in different languages:
`"Или официальное название превыше всего?"`
`(from http://ingvarr.net.ru/forum/7-251-1)`
`"اقصد يعني اذا انت عاوز تسوق مشروعك لازم ان تزيل هذه الكلمات لكي يكون البرنامج احترافي"`
`(from http://arabteam2000-forum.com/index.php?/topic/265383-%D9%83%D9%8A%D9%81-%D8%A3%D9%82%D9%88%D9%85-%D8%A8%D8%AA%D8%B3%D9%88%D9%8A%D9%82-%D8%A8%D8%B1%D9%86%D8%A7%D9%85%D8%AC-%D8%A7%D9%84%D9%85%D8%AD%D8%A7%D8%B3%D8%A8%D8%A9-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%AE%D8%A7%D8%B5-%D8%A8%D9%8A%D8%9F/)`

The Russian query could only be found with the Russian setting and Chinese. The Arabic one only in Arabic... and Chinese!
It should be noted that official google.com/google.it were able to find all 3 of the example queries I provided in different languages as expected.

I noticed that searx/searx/engines/google.py line 80 (google.cn reference) is commented out. Might this somehow be related to what is going on? Can we just comment out every country domain and let SearX use the default google.com for every language instead? Because Chinese-Google-SearX would be the optimal way to search, if only it didn't give... well... priority to results in a different language than your own.

TL;DR
Google through SearX in Chinese gets more results, can we fix every other language?

title: Preserve URL param preferences when selecting categories
body:
At the moment, specifying the GET method pref via a param (e.g. https://searx.instance/?method=GET&q=blah) causes searx to continue to use GET when for example clicking through to page 2 (https://searx.instance/?category_general=1&q=blah&pageno=2&time_range=None&language=en-US).

However, clicking on a category, e.g. "Images", causes it to revert to POST (or at least the URL reverts to https://searx.instance/). Instead this should work the same as pagination, and result in a URL of e.g. https://searx.instance/?method=GET&categories=images&q=blah

title: Yandex doesn't work with searx
body:
I've checked two searx instances, searx.me and searx.ch and neither one works with Yandex, even when it's selected as the sole search engine.
One of the instances is searx 0.11.0, another  0.12.0.
I suspect Yandex have changed their API.

EDIT: it also may be possible that Yandex has simply banned searx bots from these two servers (.ch and .me) after a number of queries. But in this case it would help to somehow notify users of the fact that Yandex is unavailable at the very least.

title: number_of_results in JSON does not match frontpage
body:
Hello,

For example the query _new york city_ shows:
> Number of results: 449,200,010

But in the JSON data the number always differs:
> {"number_of_results": 29400001, ...

Does the number in JSON represent something else? Or are maybe only a specific amount of pages returned for the JSON?

I have also noticed that when nothing has been found (``"number_of_results": 0, ``) the JSON document still shows some data. That seems to be Google's feature to show something close even no results matched the query.

Maybe you can explain.

regards,
Kevin

title: Recent changes to Oscar (default) theme causing image search UI issues
body:
After the recent changes to the Oscar default theme the image result popups don't close consistently when clicking elsewhere on the screen and frequently don't load the images in the modal, in both Firefox and Chromium. Pressing the Escape key also doesn't close the modal window.

The main changes of this new version I've observed are:

- The removal of the close button for result modal pop-ups.
- Making the result thumbnails link to the modal pop-ups rather than the original URL (I believe the previous version linked to the URL and used Javascript to override it to display the modal).

Personally prefer the previous UI with its dedicated close button and more reliable experience. Any chance the previous features could be incorporated into the theme again?

title: Infinite scroll broken without scrollbar
body: Infinite scroll does not work when the results page fits on the screen. This happens from time to time and I think the reason is fewer results being returned or the result text being minimal. This can also be reproduced when zooming out until the scrollbar disappears. I think this could possibly cause problems with different screen sizes/resolutions. Maybe there's a way to keep loading results until a scrollbar appears or detect when the user uses the scroll wheel?

title: Next Page returns the same results
body:
Hi all

Whenever I click next page or the infinite scroll happens, the same results as page 1 are displayed.

If I manually try going from page to page via the URL, I also get the same issue:

/search?category_general=1&q=test&pageno=1&time_range=
/search?category_general=1&q=test&pageno=2&time_range=

Both of these pages would have the same results, perhaps with an ordering change.

I can see the infinite scroll is correctly posting the new page number every time.

Do you know what could cause this issue?

For the record the only thing I changed was using /search for the URL instead of /searx
My server uses HTTPS.

Be aware the POST URL 'out of the box' in infinite-scroll.js was '/' which I had to manually change to '/search'.

Any advice appreciated.

title: Infinite scroll - The images from the second page are the same as in the first page
body:
- activate the "Infinite scroll" plugin
- perform an image search
- make note of the first 2-3 previews for images on the first page.
- scroll until you reach the second page
- click the first image on the second page
- it will load a full image from the first page even though the small preview is a different image.

title: 0.10.0: Wrong redirection when BASE_PATH isn't /
body:
I'm trying to setup the docker image as an additional location on my domain with an "domain.tld/searx/ location. I've configured the Apache2 server to make a ProxyPass for the mentioned location to the server with the Searx instance.

Problem: Searx seems to rewrite the URL to the root (/) location which leads to a redirect to my main webpage.

Is there any way to prevent this rewrite of the URL? This seems to be new to 0.10.0, my previous (native) installation of 0.9.0 worked as expected.

title: Return 404 on page no found
body:
Currently an URL like https://searx.example.com/test will return "Page not found" in the browser but with the http code as 200 OK.

This breaks monitoring and intrusion detection systems.

Please modify error pages to return correct http error codes.

There are two infoboxes, both of them talk about the same subject and link to the same wikipedia page.

title: Infinite scroll: answer are repeated on each page
body:
How to reproduce : search for ["user agent"](https://searx.me/?q=user+agent) with Infinite scroll activated.

Should the answer be disabled except the first page ? or should Infinite Scroll hide the answer ?

I vote for the first option : disabled answers except on the first page on the server side.

title: Wolfram Alpha engine should show result, not input
body:
While the Wolfram Alpha infobox neatly shows all (or most) information returned on a query, that is not (yet) available from API calls, and when one simlpy looks at hits from Wolfram Alpha as part of the standard list of hits, the text returned ("content" field in JSON) is the search query you made (the Wolfram Alpha "input"), instead of the "result".

See this screenshot for clarification: http://i.imgur.com/MWDHmDM.png
Instead of "2+2", the search result should probably just show "4" since the user is likely uninterested in seeing a copy of what they typed, but might like to see the result of the operation (which is available somewhere in the code as the infobox shows).

title: open_results_on_new_tab.py plugin is not in translation files
"Number of results" wrongly varies among pages and instances
body:
When making some searches on searx.me, the given "Number of results" is patently wrong, and then it  sometimes changes when I click "Next" to go to the next page of results.

I was going to provide examples but unfortunately I can't because as I tried to reproduce it with the same query as I had tried initially, things changed, and for a while it seemed to work in a plausibly correct way. So I cannot provide a URL that will always reproduce the problem.

However, try searching for some not-overly-common-but-common "phrase in double quotes", and chances are that you will sometimes see an implausibly low number of results (say below 100), but then if you hit Next, it will increase... or conversely, become zero and disappear.

title: Bug in show/hide map event listener on middle click
body:
Hey guys,

I noticed a very small bug in the results details view of map results.

I was looking at the templates and the static assets, and I only found [this event listener](https://github.com/asciimoo/searx/tree/master/searx/static/themes/oscar/js/searx_src/leaflet_map.js#L102) and I'm unsure if this exists for all templates. The default template seems to not have map functionality!?!?

I would love to fix this small bug myself with a pull request. It would be awesome if you guys could give me some hints :)

**Bug Description**

I created a [short video screencast](https://vid.me/ql5k) of the bug and uploaded it.

Video Interaction:
- 2 Middle clicks
- 2 Left clicks
- 2 Middle clicks
- 2 Left clicks

**What happens:**
- Middle click on show/hide map toggle link does not work properly.
- The show event listener switches to "hide" on middle click.
- The hide event listener does `not` switch back to `show` on middle click.

**What should happen:**
- Either have new window opened with detail view of map or ignore it completely.

**What I expected to happen:**
- Middle click opens a new window with the map link directly. So the href attribute of the link (or window.open() call afterwards) would lead to the details view.

title: [google] wrong URL
body:
With the google search engine, when I search [san francisco restaurants](http://searx.me/?q=%21google+san+francisco+restaurants) for example (any location + restaurants), the first links give restaurants and phone numbers but the URLs are wrong.

The function involved : 
https://github.com/asciimoo/searx/blob/master/searx/engines/google.py#L279

The reason : since few months ( ? ), the no javascript version of google doesn't give the direct link to web site, but instead it gives a link to google search.

I suggest either :
- to disable this feature
- or to create an infobox with the usable informations (names and phone numbers)

Related : this function doesn't to be call anymore : 
https://github.com/asciimoo/searx/blob/master/searx/engines/google.py#L220
It is triggered when you look for a specific location : a restaurant name for example.
I guess that the xpath are wrong : map_address_xpath, map_phone_xpath, map_website_url_xpath  and map_website_title_xpath

So to sum up, a quick fix is to remove the lines between 214 and 220.

title: No virtual-env: incorrect redirect when saving preferences
body:
Hi there,
First off, thanks for the great job providing this very nice tool!
I just installed my own instance, and chose for various reasons not to use the virtual environment setup. Instead I used the alternative (recommended) setup in README.rst, via _make minimal_ and _bin/searx-run_, and redirected external flow via a reverse proxy rule in my (h2o) webserver.
This setup requires the use of the **base_url** setting from _searx/settings.yml_ (**server** section), to have a consistent "Search URL" link in the bottom right panel of the search page (not doing so results in a misleading "http://localhost:_port_..." link).
I noticed however that, when saving preferences via the dedicated "save" button, preferences were saved (which is good), but the redirection was done towards the "internal" url, ie "http://localhost:_port_" (which is bad, obviously).
To correct this, I simply replaced line 534 of file _searx/webapp.py_ with the following lines:
Before:

>      resp = make_response(redirect(url_for('index')))

After:

>     if settings['server']['base_url']:
>         resp = make_response(redirect(settings['server']['base_url']))
>     else:
>           resp = make_response(redirect(url_for('index')))

This makes sure the **base_url** is used if it was set by the admin.
I only tested on my own server, but I guess the code is rather generic and should work anywhere...
Cheers,
Minami-o

edit: just noticed the same behavior on line 769 for the "Reset defaults" button, correction is exactly the same.

title: make searx installation work in subfolder
body:
Sorry, I'm a complete novice in these matters but I think I've carefully folllowed your instructions.
I cannot get searx to work from a **subfolder** of my domain. It will run fine in the root folder of any (sub)domain but not from a subfolder (which is what I need).
Here's what I did:

In the _searx/searx/settings.yml_ I set

`base_url https://mydomain.com/search/` 

and inside the _subfolder_ named _search_ I have this _htaccess_

```
RewriteEngine On   
RewriteBase /   
RewriteRule ^(.*) http://127.0.0.1:58630/$1 [P]   
```

(also tried it without the RewriteBase)

This is not working in the subfolder. 
Files from the static folder are not loaded. And if I hit search anyway it defaults to my root folder and gives an error (there's nothing in there). 
I think it's a path problem, maybe it's still treating this as an installation in a root folder instead of a subfolder. 

I should add that this is running in a shared web hosting environment. Therefore I'm not allowed to make changes to Apache or nginx configuration settings (if they were necessary).

Could you _please_ tell me what I need to do to make searx work from a _sub_folder? After many hours and days I've run out of ideas. If there is a way, maybe you could add a line to the installation instructions for other beginners.
Thank you so much.

title: currency engine : regex
body:
https://github.com/asciimoo/searx/blob/master/searx/engines/currency_convert.py#L12
the regex should be something like 

```
^\W*(\d+(?:\.\d+)?)\W+([^.0-9].+)\W+in?\W*([^\.]+)\W*$
```

some `\W*` are replaced by `\W+`, may be a better one could be found.

fro now,  the currency engine catches `3d dinosaures` : 
http://searx.me/?q=3d+dinosaures&category_general=on

curl 'https://searx.me/?q=10 $ in EUR'    -> OK (200)

title: Problem with parse_images() in google.py.
body:
Hello. In the google.py engine, you have a function parse_images() that is responsible for the displaying of images in the result of the "General" search engine Google (go).
https://github.com/asciimoo/searx/blob/master/searx/engines/google.py#L102

There is one issue with the images displayed: those are thumbnails from google. Moreover, the images link to those thumbnails, instead of redirecting to the original image, or to the website hosting those images.

I don't think it's possible to get the link to the original image, because it's calculated in js in the google search results, but it could be a better solution to link to the website hosting the images instead of redirecting to useless thumbnails.

You can "reproduce" this behaviour by desactiving all the search engines but the google one, and trying to search something like "image of stuff".

title: Flickr engine: no results provided
body:
Probably invalid session cookie causes the bug.
Investigation and fix required.

title: Broken ssl module: TypeError: __init__() got an unexpected keyword argument 'server_hostname'
body:
This is a continuation of what I am experiencing in #92 .

Here is the complete stacktrace, for reference:

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/gevent/greenlet.py", line 327, in run
    result = self._run(*self.args, **self.kwargs)
  File "/var/www/search.example.com/searx/venv/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/grequests.py", line 71, in send
    self.url, **merged_kwargs)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/requests/sessions.py", line 456, in request
    resp = self.send(prep, **send_kwargs)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/requests/sessions.py", line 559, in send
    r = adapter.send(request, **kwargs)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/requests/adapters.py", line 327, in send
    timeout=timeout
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/urllib3/connectionpool.py", line 516, in urlopen
    body=body, headers=headers)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/urllib3/connectionpool.py", line 304, in _make_request
    self._validate_conn(conn)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/urllib3/connectionpool.py", line 724, in _validate_conn
    conn.connect()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/urllib3/connection.py", line 237, in connect
    ssl_version=resolved_ssl_version)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/urllib3/util/ssl_.py", line 123, in ssl_wrap_socket
    return context.wrap_socket(sock, server_hostname=server_hostname)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/ssl.py", line 350, in wrap_socket
    _context=self)
TypeError: __init__() got an unexpected keyword argument 'server_hostname'
<Greenlet at 0xb65269dcL: <bound method AsyncRequest.send of <grequests.AsyncRequest object at 0xb64e508c>>(stream=False)> failed with TypeError
```

I am using a virtualenv on an up-to-date Debian/testing (jessie).

It seems that grequests redefined an ssl module, that want to have the same API as Python 2.7. Unfortunately, they introduced server_hostname and other niceties in Python 2.7.9 that seem to have been backported in Debian. And the wrapper is now broken.
Maybe I'm missing something, somewhere… But now, I am unable to have results for all HTTPS sites. This is quite annoying :smile:

title: default theme option doesn't work
body: If I set another `default_theme` in settings.yml, it doesn't change (cookies are cleared and searx were restarted)

title: autocomplete : remove bang from search string
body:
When a search for "!ddd linux", the suggested search string contains "ddd linux"

searx should ignore "!ddd" since it's a bang and not a searched word.

Extended version : the autocomplete feature should suggest all the bangs when the user type "!"

title: Google Web Search API deprecated
body:
The google, google_news, google_image engines use the Google Web Search API.
According to https://developers.google.com/web-search/docs/ the service stops the September 29, 2014 !

title: make test script to check if engines are parsed correct
body:
Because the engines does not work allways wit an official api, it would be useful to make a script which check regulary if the engines return valide results.

currently the flickr engine is broken, probably blocked by flickr itself.

title: allowing searx-instance outsite the Root directory
body:
I have installed a searx in "http://localhost/searx" to test it.

The Problem is, that all urls for css, js, images,... reference to the root-directory.

As example, the line:

``` HTML
<link rel="stylesheet" href="/static/css/style.css" type="text/css" media="screen" />
```

reference to the url "http://localhost/static/css/style.css", and not to the url "http://localhost/**searx/**static/css/style.css"

title: Problem with yahoo & twitter engines when used from a mobile phone
body:
When used from a mobile phone, the yahoo and the twitter engines doesn't return any results. Explanation : Yahoo and Twitter see the mobile user agent and change the result page layout.

I see two solutions : 
- the yahoo / twitter are modified to support the mobile page version.
- searx doesn't send the user agent for those engine (or all engine ?)

Question : why sending the user agent is important ?
